meanings.definition: The crisp residue left after rendering fat from meat.
meanings.sent1: I love the cracklings that form on the edges of bacon.
meanings.sent2: The chef sprinkled the cracklings on top of the salad for added crunch.
meanings.sent3: The cracklings on the pork chop were so crunchy, they could wake up the neighbors!
meanings.sent4: The cracklings of laughter filled the room as the friends shared jokes.
meanings.sent5: The cracklings in the pan sizzled and popped, releasing a delicious aroma.

meanings.definition: A small piece of crackling or similar substance.
meanings.sent1: She nibbled on the cracklings of the crispy pork skin.
meanings.sent2: The baker added cracklings of chocolate to the cookie dough.
meanings.sent3: The cracklings of paint on the old door gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent4: The cracklings of leaves underfoot signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The cracklings of excitement in the crowd grew as the concert started.

meanings.sent1: The cracklings of the fire in the fireplace were soothing on a cold night.
meanings.sent2: The cracklings of the twigs under their feet echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cracklings of the old record player added a nostalgic touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: The cracklings of thunder in the distance warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The cracklings of excitement in the air could be felt before the surprise was revealed.
